title: Jagannath Rath Yatra: 3 dead, 50 injured in stampede near Puri’s Gundicha Temple
content: Tragedy struck during the Rath Yatra festival in Puri, India, as a stampede near the Gundicha Temple resulted in at least three fatalities and numerous injuries. Prior to the stampede, hundreds of devotees were hospitalized due to exhaustion and crowd pressure during the Rath Yatra.

title: Kolkata horror: Prime accused's one-liner for every girl - 'Tui amay biye korbi?'
content: Monojit Mishra, accused of rape, displayed a history of disturbing behavior, including circulating morphed images, filming private moments, and body-shaming women. Despite multiple complaints of harassment and assault, no action was taken against him, fostering a climate of fear. Students describe him as a terror, highlighting the college's failure to address his actions due to his political connections.

title: Char Dham Yatra suspended for 24 hours amid heavy rain alert in Uttarakhand
content: The Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand has been temporarily suspended for 24 hours following severe weather warnings. Authorities have halted pilgrims in Rishikesh and other safe locations along the route. The Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rainfall across several districts. Garhwal Commissioner Vinay Shankar Pandey confirmed the suspension, emphasizing close monitoring of the situation.

title: 'Most people don't even have a 13-year career': Rohit Sharma opens up
content: Rohit Sharma reflects on India's thrilling seven-run victory over South Africa in Barbados, securing the ICC T20 World Cup after a 13-year wait. He recalls the sleepless night before the final, filled with nerves and anticipation. The tournament marked a significant farewell for legends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from T20s, with Rohit shining as the second-highest run-scorer.

title: Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' clears key hurdle in Senate
content: Senate Republicans advanced President Trump's economic package, featuring tax cuts, spending reductions, and deportation funding, through a procedural vote. The bill faces further debate and amendments, with some Republicans expressing concerns over program cuts. Elon Musk criticized the bill, warning of job losses and strategic harm, as the White House urges its passage.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: Two strong earthquakes jolt Pakistan within 12 hours
content: Pakistan experienced a 4.5 magnitude earthquake on Sunday morning, following a stronger 5.2 magnitude quake earlier in the day. The recent tremor occurred at a shallow depth of 10 kilometers, increasing the potential for aftershocks and stronger ground shaking. No immediate reports of injuries or major damage have surfaced, but authorities are closely monitoring the situation.

title: 'Iran could restart uranium enrichment in months': IAEA chief's big claim
content: IAEA chief Rafael Grossi warns that Iran could resume uranium enrichment within months, despite recent US and Israeli airstrikes. While Iran doesn't currently possess nuclear weapons, unexplained uranium traces were found at undeclared sites. The IAEA lacks knowledge of the current location of Iran's enriched uranium stockpile, raising concerns about its potential use.

title: OTD: India ended a decade of heartbreak with 2024 T20 World Cup glory
content: In 2024, Team India secured a memorable T20 World Cup victory, ending a decade-long drought in ICC knockouts. They remained unbeaten, defeating strong teams like Australia, Pakistan, and England. The final against South Africa saw India defend a total of 176, winning by seven runs.

title: Zerodha’s Nikhil Kamath warns: Days of 4-yr college courses over; only this skill matter's
content: Nikhil Kamath warns that traditional college degrees are becoming obsolete, emphasizing lifelong learning for career survival amidst rapid technological advancements. The World Economic Forum predicts significant job market disruption by 2030, with millions needing upskilling to avoid unemployment. Adaptability and AI expertise are crucial, highlighting a growing disconnect between education and evolving market demands.

title: Who was Saquib Nachan? ISIS-linked terror accused dies
content: Saquib Nachan, a convicted terrorist with links to ISIS, died at Safdarjung Hospital in New Delhi while undergoing treatment. Nachan, who was serving time in Tihar Jail, had been transferred to the hospital due to his deteriorating health. He was convicted for his involvement in the 2002-03 Mumbai bomb blasts and was allegedly involved in promoting ISIS activities in India.

title: Did Tharoor defend RSS? Here's what he said on Rahul's 'Manusmriti' charge
content: Shashi Tharoor appears to diverge from Rahul Gandhi's criticism of the RSS, acknowledging the historical context of Golwalkar's preference for Manusmriti while suggesting the RSS has evolved. This comes amid growing tensions between Tharoor and the Congress leadership, highlighted by cryptic social media posts and differing views on PM Modi's diplomacy, leading to indirect rebukes from party leaders.

title: IND vs ENG: 'No brainer for India' — Clarke’s message to Gambhir
content: Following India's defeat in the first Test against England, former Australia captain Michael Clarke advocates for Kuldeep Yadav's inclusion in the second Test at Edgbaston. Clarke emphasizes Kuldeep's wicket-taking ability, suggesting India prioritizes bowlers who can secure 20 wickets. Echoing this sentiment, former England batter Nick Knight believes Kuldeep's variations could challenge England's aggressive batting.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; says it will be world's most valuable
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: Cloudburst in Uttarakhand: 8–9 workers missing at hotel site in Uttarkashi
content: A cloudburst in Baligarh, Uttarkashi district, has led to significant damage at an under-construction hotel along the Barkot-Yamunotri road. Authorities report that eight to nine workers are missing from the site. Rescue operations are underway, with teams from the SDRF, NDRF, and local police actively involved in the search.

title: 'Utterly insane': Musk takes on Trump again, slams Senate draft of 'big bill'
content: Elon Musk has strongly criticized the "Big Beautiful Bill," warning it would devastate American jobs and strategically harm the nation. He argues the bill favors outdated industries while crippling future-oriented sectors. The Senate is pushing for the bill's passage, aiming to present it to President Trump by July 4, despite concerns from various groups about its potential negative impacts.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: 'Deserves contempt': India rejects Pakistan army's claim over Waziristan atta
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has vehemently rejected accusations from the Pakistan Army linking India to a deadly suicide bombing in North Waziristan that killed 16 soldiers. The MEA dismissed the claims as contemptible, despite the Pakistan Taliban faction claiming responsibility for the attack. The bombing, which involved an explosives-laden vehicle, also injured dozens and damaged nearby homes.

title: Mauritius drug bust: 6-yr-old Brit detained; cannabis worth £1.6 mn found
content: A six-year-old British boy was detained in Mauritius alongside several adults in connection with a £1.6 million drug trafficking operation. Authorities at Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam International Airport discovered 161kg of cannabis concealed in their luggage.

title: 'India appears truly grand from space': Shubhanshu Shukla tells PM Modi
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian on the ISS, shared his experience with PM Modi, emphasizing Earth's unity from space and its alignment with India's values. PM Modi lauded Shukla's journey as a catalyst for India's Gaganyaan mission and future space endeavors. Shukla highlighted ongoing scientific experiments and inspired India's youth to pursue their dreams.

title: Chess: ‘Whole lot of letters...’ — Carlsen welcomes Praggnanandhaa
content: Magnus Carlsen's Team Liquid welcomes the young Indian chess prodigy, R Praggnanandhaa, ahead of the Esports World Cup in Riyadh. Praggnanandhaa joins other Indian players in the esports arena, while Carlsen and other grandmasters have already secured their spots. Praggnanandhaa will compete in the Last Chance Qualifiers for a chance to participate in the tournament.

title: Amid opposition protests, EC starts Bihar rolls revision
content: Ignoring opposition protests, the Election Commission has initiated a special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. This exercise requires electors enrolled after 2003 to submit citizenship proof, with 98,450 booth level officers conducting door-to-door verification. The EC justifies the revision by citing constitutional requirements for voter eligibility and adherence to electoral roll revision rules before elections.

title: Revealed: Faces of Keeladi men; 3D recon brings 2,500-yr-old skulls into shape
content: Archaeological findings at Keeladi, Tamil Nadu, reveal a 6th century BCE civilization, with facial reconstructions of two individuals from Kondagai burial site offering insights into their South Indian ancestry, including West Eurasian and Austro-Asiatic traces.

title: Psychopath 'Mango' terror in Kolkata college, say juniors
content: Monojit Mishra, the primary suspect in a Kolkata rape case, displayed a history of psychopathic behavior and sexual violence, according to former classmates. Despite numerous complaints of harassment and assault, Mishra faced no consequences and maintained influence on campus. Other co-accused individuals are also involved, raising concerns about the safety and accountability within the college environment.

title: CJI terms ‘creamy layer’ ruling within SC/STs a milestone
content: Chief Justice of India Bhushan Gavai emphasized the importance of the creamy layer principle within SC/STs. He cautioned against judicial overreach and highlighted the Constitution's role in social transformation. Gavai mentioned landmark judgments, including those on Article 370 and electoral bonds. He also addressed pending cases and infrastructure improvements. Gavai ruled out post-retirement assignments, focusing on his current responsibilities.

title: 'Let Bibi go': Trump slams Netanyahu trial as ‘witch hunt’; warns of..
content: Donald Trump has strongly defended Benjamin Netanyahu, denouncing the Israeli Prime Minister's corruption trial as a "POLITICAL WITCH HUNT." Trump lauded Netanyahu as a "War Hero" and praised his efforts in countering Iran's nuclear ambitions. He also highlighted Netanyahu's ongoing negotiations with Hamas for hostage release, questioning the timing of the trial amidst such critical diplomatic efforts.

title: Abhishek Bachchan unplugged: 'For us Amitabh Bachchan is hero, but he's allowed to be …
content: Abhishek Bachchan reveals he can do a much better job with 'Guru' if he got the chance now all over again to do the film. He also opens up on losing a bit of his innocence because that's the birth of a true artist, how his parents are proud of him, not being expressive in real life, reaction to social media trolling and more in this second part of the interview.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office collection: Film marches past Rs 100 crore mark
content: Aamir Khan's new film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is a box office hit. The movie has earned over Rs 100 crore. Despite competition from other films, it continues to attract audiences. The film saw a big jump in collections on its second Saturday. Aamir Khan plays a basketball coach in the film. The movie features new actors.

title: Spymaster behind Op Sindoor is RAW chief
content: IPS officer Parag Jain, an expert on Pakistan and China, has been appointed as the new head of RAW, succeeding Ravi Sinha. His appointment, effective July 1, comes after his crucial role in Operation Sindoor. Jain's focus will be on leveraging technology for intelligence, monitoring diaspora communities, and countering hybrid warfare, particularly from China and Pakistan.

title: 'Kannappa' Box Office collection day 2: Movie set to cross Rs 20 crore
content: Vishnu Manchu's Kannappa is performing well at the box office. The film earned Rs 9.35 crore on its opening day. Day two collections reached Rs 7 crore, totaling Rs 16.35 crore. Telugu regions show strong occupancy. Tamil Nadu and Hindi versions also see rising viewership. The mythological action-drama features Prabhas, Akshay Kumar, Kajal Aggarwal, and Mohanlal in brief roles.

title: Bihar drive: EC to refer illegals for action under Citizenship Act
content: Electoral Registration Officers will now scrutinize voter roll inclusions and deletions, referring suspected foreign nationals to citizenship authorities. They will conduct inquiries, issue notices, and pass speaking orders, ensuring fair hearings for those excluded.

title: Republicans laud NYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani; contrasts earlier criticism
content: In a surprising turn, prominent Republicans like Marjorie Taylor Greene and Tucker Carlson have praised Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani's grassroots campaign strategy, despite disagreeing with his policies. Mamdani's focus on local issues and direct engagement with constituents has garnered unexpected recognition, even as other Republicans express strong opposition and hostility towards his political ideology and proposals.

title: My government committed to freeing India from colonial mindset: PM Modi
content: PM Modi, addressing the centenary celebrations of Acharya Vidyanand Maharaj, reiterated his government's commitment to decolonization, emphasizing the importance of both development and heritage. He highlighted the promotion of Indian languages and the recognition of Prakrit as a classical language.

title: Railways may allow more IDs for tatkal booking authentication
content: Indian Railways is considering expanding the list of acceptable documents for IRCTC account authentication beyond Aadhaar, potentially including PAN Card, driving license, and voter ID via Digilocker. This update, possibly announced on Monday, aims to streamline Tatkal ticket bookings, which serve around 2.2 lakh passengers daily. The decision follows a review meeting chaired by Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife in dance tribute for La La Anthony, honors Kobe Bryant & Michael Jordan
content: Ciara Princess Wilson celebrated her best friend La La Anthony's birthday with a stylish video, captivating fans from the NFL and NBA. The singer also shared moments from Fanatics Fest, including a heartfelt tribute to basketball legends Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant, highlighting her connections within the sports world and her enduring friendships.

title: ‘Misogyny cuts...’: Mahua Moitra reacts as TMC distances from Kalyan, Mitra remarks
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has openly criticized her party colleagues, Kalyan Banerjee and Madan Mitra, for their controversial remarks regarding the Kolkata law college gang-rape case, emphasizing that misogyny transcends party lines in India. The AITC swiftly disassociated itself from the leaders' comments, condemning them strongly.

title: Win for Trump in SC: Indian families lose shield - citizenship fight gets personal
content: In a 6-3 decision, the US Supreme Court partially upheld President Trump's executive order on birthright citizenship, restricting federal judges' ability to issue nationwide injunctions. While the EO's constitutionality remains under review, the ruling's impact extends beyond birthright citizenship, potentially overwhelming courts with individual lawsuits.

title: Kolkata rape accused was ousted from college TMC unit in 2021; got seat despite limit
content: Manojit Mishra, accused in a law college rape case, is estranged from his father, who emphasizes accountability if his son is guilty. Mishra, once a promising law student, became involved in campus politics, facing allegations of rowdyism and misconduct.

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur
content: “Security forces also recovered arms and ammunition, including a rifle, guns, live cartridges and a hand grenade, during an operation near Ngariyan Hill in Imphal East district,” a police officer said

title: Congress takes dig at BJP’s ‘Alwar double engine’ over plan to ‘redraw’ Sariska reserve’s boundary
content: The Opposition party also said that with the Rajasthan and Union Environment Ministers both being from Alwar,  this "double engine" cannot be supporting  such a move.

title: Tamil Nadu government decides not to extend Rosewood Conservation Act
content: Initially passed for 15 years in 1995, the Act was renewed in 2010 for another 15-year period to prevent the illegal felling and trade of the trees. However, the government has decided that continuing the Act is no longer necessary

title: At least 3 killed, several injured in Puri’s Jagannath Rath Yatra stampede
content: The incident took place  when devotees had been waiting to have Darshan of Lord BalabhadraLord Jagannath and Devi Subhdra on chariots

title: What to B.E.
content: It is the admission season again in engineering colleges in Tamil Nadu and early trends show that Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Machine Learning are top choices of students, reflecting the national mood. R. Sujatha speaks to academics, who point to the worrisome, continuing trend of lack of patronage for core courses such as Civil and Mechanical Engineering

title: Nine labourers missing after cloudburst in Uttarakhand’s Uttarkashi
content: A team rushed to the spot and found that labourers engaged in road construction work lived there by putting up tents. They are feared to have been swept away by heavy rain

title: Indian students opting for Australia as immigration policies tighten in U.S., U.K.: Experts
content: Notably, India ranks second in international student enrolments to Australian universities between 2003 and 2024, according to data from the Australian government’s Education Department

title: CM Nitish Kumar hands over job letters to 21,391 police constables
content: Attacking the previous government of RJD, Mr. Kumar said that people did not use to come out of the house after evening and the law and order situation was bad

title: Black-headed caterpillar infestation in coconut trees: CM Siddaramaiah seeks expert panel report on control of disease
content: “The caterpillars reside in silken galleries built on the undersides of leaves and consume the green portions, reducing the plant’s photosynthetic ability”

title: Padma Sesidhar is new Director for Public Health and Family Welfare Department of A.P.
content: More than 7,000 healthcare and supporting staff have been transferred as part of the overhauling of Health Department

title: DGCA urged to relocate Begumpet airport to Dundigal, citing safety and urban congestion concerns
content: “The Begumpet airport currently operates on a limited scale, primarily for VIP chartered flights and operations by the IAF, making it an underutilised asset”

title: Those who are staying illegally in U.S. will be held responsible: Embassy
content: The Embassy's statement comes against the backdrop of an immigration crackdown by the Trump administration in California's Los Angeles recently

title: A.P. CM tells officials to mobilise maximum Central funds for MA&UD Department
content: Officials instructed to speed up works undertaken as part of AMRUT, AMRUT-2, AIIB and UIDF schemes; CM calls for a poultry waste management policy

title: Large genetic map of Indians flags hidden disease risks
content: The study also confirmed that present-day Indians descend primarily from a single out-of-Africa migration around 50,000 years ago

title: Keeladi | Excavating the past
content: Findings at the excavation site in Sivaganga district offer compelling evidence that urban civilisation existed in Tamil Nadu during the Sangam age

title: BJP bringing up Katchatheevu issue to divert attention from Centre’s failure to secure T.N. fishermen’s rights: TNCC chief
content: Refuting External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar’s statement, he clarifies that Katchatheevu was ceded to Sri Lanka during Emergency

title: What are the issues around deportation? | Explained
content: Why is there a distinction to be made between people who are being deported and those who are being pushed back? What are the different laws that deal with immigration and foreigners in India? What is the situation on the ground in border States such as Assam and West Bengal?

title: India slams Pakistan for seeking to blame it for attack in Waziristan
content: We reject this statement with the contempt it deserves, says Ministry of External Affairs in a statement

title: Seven PWD officials suspended, enquiry against one retired official over Bhopal’s near 90-degree turn bridge
content: A construction agency and the design consultant, hired for the job, have also been blacklisted for giving a “faulty design” for the project, says Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

title: TMC condemns Kalyan Banerjee’s comments on Kolkata law college rape
content: Facing flak for his remarks Mr. Banerjee hit back at his own party saying that leaders who joined party after 2011 are responsible for such crimes.

title: BRS extends support to ‘Chalo Secretariat’ protest march planned by unemployed youth
content: Party leader T. Harish Rao accuses govt. of betraying youth, student communities, and demands white paper on jobs filled

title: BRS spreading false propaganda on safety of Jurala and Manjeera projects, says Irrigation Minister
content: Chief Minister sanctioned ₹100 crore for an alternative bridge to protect Jurala, says Uttam Kumar Reddy

title: DYFI leaders demand immediate release of job calendar
content: Though the previous government had issued 18 notifications through the A.P. Public Service Commission, recruitments were pending on account of legal tangles, say leaders

title: A.P. Waqf Board plans to support poor Muslims through P4 initiative
content: Rent Review Committee will be formed at the State level to review the rents of 1,300 shops directly managed by the board in various areas, says Waqf Board Chairman

title: Former IAS officer M.S. Ramesh passes away at 90
content: Belonging to the 1958 batch, she has served in positions including Joint Secretary in the Finance and Industries Departments and Chairperson of the Tamil Nadu Corporation for Development of Women Limited

title: Punjab government to enact law imposing harsher punishment for sacrilege of religious scriptures, say CM
content: CM Bhagwant Mann says this process will be completed shortly to assuage the sentiments of the public and very soon a Cabinet meeting will be convened on the issue

title: Topuria KO's Oliveira cold, now 2-division champ
content: Ilia Topuria needed just one round to finish Charles Oliveira, knocking him out cold to capture the vacant lightweight title in the UFC 317 main event.

title: Sources: Bulls trading Ball to Cavs for Okoro
content: The Chicago Bulls are trading Lonzo Ball to the Cleveland Cavaliers for Isaac Okoro, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Batum opts out; interest in Clips return
content: There's mutual interest between Nicolas Batum and the Clippers in a new deal together after the veteran forward opted out, sources told ESPN.

title: 'A joke': Chelsea coach slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Ohtani uncorks 101.7 mph fastball in third start
content: Shohei Ohtani threw the fastest pitch of his career at 101.7 mph and worked two efficient innings in his third mound start for the Los Angeles Dodgers, allowing one hit and one walk against the Kansas City Royals on Saturday.

title: Elliott uses last lap to post 'unbelievable' win
content: Home-state favorite Chase Elliott passed Brad Keselowski on the final lap and won the the crash-filled NASCAR Cup Series at Atlanta Saturday night for his 20th career victory, saying afterward that "this is something I'll remember the rest of my life."

title: Hall of Famer Wilkens feted with statue in Seattle
content: Lenny Wilkens, the legendary former SuperSonics player, coach and executive, was honored Saturday as the first person to have a statue unveiled outside Climate Pledge Arena in Seattle.

title: 🏀 2026 NBA mock draft: Four top prospects
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Winners, losers and top moments of the 2025 NHL draft
content: The decentralized draft took the teams out of the arena, but there was no shortage of memorable moments.

title: What we're hearing about Luka, LeBron and the Lakers' offseason
content: After a disappointing first-round playoff flameout, here's an early look at the Lakers' top priorities and targets over the next few weeks.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Paige Bueckers meets 'favorite player' Kyrie Irving after historic performance
content: The Dallas Wings star called the moment surreal as she posed with Kyrie Irving and signed a jersey for him.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: 'It's better if Messi plays angry': Can revenge fuel Inter Miami to shock win vs. PSG?
content: Inter Miami defied expectations by reaching the round of 16 at the Club World Cup. Now comes the really hard part: a date with the European champions ... and Messi's former club.

title: Luis Enrique: PSG can't relax vs. best ever Messi
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique warned his players against ignoring the offensive threats of Lionel Messi and Inter Miami in Sunday's Club World Cup match.

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Klopp: Expanded Club World Cup the worst idea
content: Former Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp has criticised the introduction of the expanded Club World Cup format, calling it the worst idea ever implemented in football.

title: Poch hails 'great' Navas ahead of Gold Cup reunion
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino hailed Costa Rica goalkeeper Keylor Navas as "one of the best in the world" ahead of Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to €65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ronaldo: Saudi league already top 5 in the world
content: Cristiano Ronaldo preferred to take a rest rather than play in the revamped Club World Cup, he said on Saturday after renewing his contract with Al Nassr.

title: Schmelzel, Valenzuela team up to take Dow lead
content: Sarah Schmelzel and Albane Valenzuela took a one-shot lead Saturday in the Dow Championship after shooting a 2-under 68 in alternate-shot play.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Ravens' Kyle Hamilton reveals engagement to longtime girlfriend on Instagram
content: The Baltimore Ravens safety and Reese Damm, his now-fiancée, have been dating since high school and announced their engagement via a shared Instagram post.

title: PLL Power Rankings: Cannons the new No. 1
content: Margins are tight this season, but one club has risen to the top. Where do the rest land in the rankings?

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to swoop on Newcastle target Pedro
content: Chelsea and Newcastle are battling it out to sign Brighton star Joao Pedro. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: Women's Euros A-Z: The history of the tournament in 26 facts
content: England won the Women's Euros in 2022 and will attempt to retain it this summer, but before the fun gets started, let's run through the tournament's memorable moments.

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: Centre has sanctioned projects worth ₹1,156.15 crore to Tamil Nadu, says Fisheries Ministry
content: In a statement, the Department of Fisheries under the Ministry said an additional fund of ₹262.42 crore was released for implementation of Blue Revolution Scheme (during 2017-18) to Tamil Nadu for implementation of the projects approved under PMMSY.

title: West Bengal CPI(M) leaders meet family of girl killed in Kaliganj bomb explosion
content: The police arrested four more persons in connection with the crude bomb explosion that killed Tammana Khatun, 9, on June 23; among those arrested is a local Trinamool Congress leader, Gawal Sheikh

title: L-G Sinha reviews arrangements for Amarnath Yatra with stakeholders
content: Civil society members, religious leaders, political representatives assure full support for smooth conduct of annual pilgrimage

title: Government should take Opposition leaders into confidence on Trump’s claims of ‘opening up’ India: Congress leader Anand Sharma
content: Mr. Sharma, a former Commerce Minister, says India’s national interests must be protected, and it must continue to uphold a rules-based multilateral trade regime and honour WTO agreements

title: Protests escalate over Kolkata student rape case, BJP State President Sukanta Majumdar detained
content: Senior Trinamool Congress MP Kalyan Banerjee’s comment on the rape incident sparks widespread outrage and criticism; Kolkata Mayor Firhad Hakim denies any official association of the prime accused with the Trinamool Congress

title: Bihar begins Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls; 2.93 crore voters asked to produce proof of birth date and place
content: The last SIR in Bihar was done in 2003; all those whose names were not in the rolls at that time asked to produce documents to prove their eligibility to vote; “serious threat of disenfranchisement,” Opposition says

title: Thiruvananthapuram medical college scrambles for explanation after Urology head’s social media lament
content: Harris Chirakkal’s Facebook post spoke of cancelling a 23-year-old boy’s surgery at the eleventh hour. He cited a lack of equipment required for the procedure at the hospital

title: Secondary pollutants constitute up to third of PM2.5 pollution
content: CREA study flags widespread presence of ammonium sulphate and sulphur dioxide presence in many cities

title: Pinarayi Vijayan defends Minister V. Sivankutty on latter’s walkout from Raj Bhavan
content: Sivankutty merely responded the way a Minister should on seeing a flag and symbol not mandated by the Constitution at an official function, says Pinarayi

title: Congress says the BJP is delaying implementing 27% OBC reservation in Madhya Pradesh
content: The lack of implementation of the quota shows that the BJP is against reservation, said Congress leaders

title: 3.6 magnitude earthquake hits J&K; no reports of loss of life or damage to property
content: The quake hit Jammu and Kashmir at 7:36 p.m. at a latitude of 32.96 degrees north and a longitude of 74.71 degrees east with a depth of nine k.m., officials said.

title: SFI to get new national leadership today
content: SFI leaders allege that Governors are acting like “RSS agents” to intrude into the education sector, pointing to the recent ‘Bharat Mata’ controversy at the Kerala Raj Bhavan as an example

title: There will be no hasty decision on minimum wage hike proposal: Shivakumar
content: The Deputy Chief Minister says he has advised Labour Minister Santosh Lad not to take any immediate decision on the proposal

title: ‘Beyond Tomorrow’ meet moots creative incubator to explore new avenues
content: Stakeholders from various creative sectors turn up for the event that proposed the idea of a creative incubator in the State under KSUM

title: Airport staff passes to be linked to facial technology, vehicle number plates, and FASTags
content: Integration of airport entry passes would help in curbing ‘insider threat’, and ‘digitised standard operating procedures will also lead to smarter and quicker responses to any security concerns,’ the CISF said

title: Private schools in Andhra Pradesh warned against turning down admissions under RTE Act
content: Denial of admissions without valid reason will invite departmental action, says Samagra Shiksha State Project Director Srinivasa Rao; deadline for completing the admissions has been extended to July 2

title: Local MSMEs emerging as global contenders, says Minister
content: The signing of 101 MoUs and business agreements, involving 40 first-time exporters and 38 women entrepreneurs becomes major highlight of the International Reverse Buyer-Seller Meet in Tirupati

title: Chennai-bound Air India flight returns to Mumbai due to ‘burning smell’ in cabin
content: “Air India flight AI 639, operating from Mumbai to Chennai, on Friday, June 27, made a precautionary air-return to Mumbai due to a burning smell in the cabin,” the airline said in a statement

title: 300-bed polytrauma centre at NIMHANS north campus in Bengaluru
content: This will be the second polytrauma centre in India, after the Jayaprakash Narayan Apex Trauma Centre at AIIMS, New Delhi

title: Three arrested on charge of committing irregularities in issuance of e-stamps in Andhra Pradesh
content: Police seize three mobile phones, three CPUs, three monitors, printers, laptop, 88 empty e-stamps and other documents from their possession

title: A.P. govt. urged to set up pharma innovation centre in Srikakulam district
content: Migration of students to other States and countries will decrease if industries, research centres, and laboratories are established in the region, says Pulsus Group CEO

title: Seven Engineers Suspended Over Bhopal Bridge With 90-Degree Turn
content: The newly built over-bridge became a subject of criticism and ridicule, with residents questioning its design.

title: "Misogyny": Mahua Moitra On Trinamool Leaders' Remarks On Kolkata Rape Case
content: A female student was allegedly gang-raped inside the South Calcutta Law College in Kolkata's Kasba on Wednesday.

title: Pakistan Blames India For Suicide Car Bomb Attack, Centre Responds
content: The Ministry of External Affairs on Sunday strongly rejected the Pakistan Army's claim that India was behind the Waziristan suicide bomber attack, which killed 13 soldiers a day earlier.

title: "Everyone Liked Gajar Halwa, Aam Ras": Shubhanshu Shukla Tells PM Modi From Space
content: The Prime Minister, who interacted with Group Captain Shukla, asked about his well-being and if he had tasted the 'Gajar ka halwa' he took with him.

title: India Ahead Of Neighbours In Egg Intake, But Still Lags Global Average
content: Experts link India's upward trend to rising incomes, better access to food, and increasing awareness about the importance of dietary protein.

title: Mizoram May Seize IDs Of Refugees Who Often Cross Border To And From Myanmar
content: The Mizoram government is considering confiscating the identity cards of Myanmar refugees who repeatedly cross the international border to and from the neighbouring country, an official said on Friday.

title: 'Shielding Criminals?' Trinamool Raps MP Over Rape Remark, He Claps Back
content: The Trinamool Congress, facing a relentless attack from the BJP over the links of the main accused in the Kolkata law student rape case to its student wing, found itself sinking deeper into a quagmire on Saturday.

title: "Why Did She Go There?" Trinamool MLA's Shocker On Kolkata Law Student's Rape
content: Adding fuel to the raging fire that his party is fighting after the rape of a law student in Kolkata, Trinamool Congress MLA Madan Mitra appeared to apportion at least a part of the blame to the woman herself.

title: Kerala Boy, 5, Bitten By Stray Dog Last Month, Dies Despite Being Vaccinated
content: A five-year-old boy who was bitten by a stray dog last month died at the Pariyaram Medical College Hospital here on Saturday despite being vaccinated.

title: Religious Sites In Mumbai Now "Loudspeaker-Free": Top Cop
content: Mumbai Police Commissioner Deven Bharti on Saturday asserted that the city is now entirely free of directional loudspeakers after its personnel successfully completed a comprehensive crackdown on public address systems.

title: Washington Post Journalist Thomas LeGro Arrested For Possessing Child Porn
content: The 48-year-old Washington Post reporter made his first appearance in the United States District Court on Friday in connection with the case.

title: Delhi To See Its First-Ever Artificial Rain To Combat Air Pollution In July
content: In a first for the national capital, Delhi is set to witness artificial rain aimed at reducing air pollution, with cloud seeding scheduled between July 4 and 11, subject to weather conditions, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said.

title: Uttarakhand BJP Expels Ex-MLA From Party Over Alleged Second Marriage
content: The ruling BJP in Uttarakhand expelled former MLA Suresh Rathore from the party for six years on Saturday following a controversy over his alleged second marriage.

title: Meitei Civil Groups From Manipur To Hold Talks With Centre In Delhi On Monday
content: A delegation of civil society organisations of the Meitei community in Manipur will hold talks with the Ministry of Home Affairs in Delhi on June 30 over the current situation in the ethnic strife-torn state, officials said on Saturday.

title: Heavy Rains In Kerala, Weather Office Issues Orange Alert In 7 Districts
content: As heavy rains lashed various parts of Kerala, water in many rivers rose to dangerous levels prompting evacuation of hundreds of people living in low-lying areas and riverbanks.

title: Bridge With 90-Degree Angle: Madhya Pradesh Government Takes Action Against 8 Engineers
content: The Madhya Pradesh government on Saturday suspended seven engineers including two chief engineers of the Public Works Department for the faulty design of the new Rail Over Bridge in Aishbagh area of the city with an unusual 90-degree turn.

title: Himanta Sarma Launches 'Emergency Diaries', Calls For Removing 'Secularism, Socialism' From Constitution
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, while addressing the media on Saturday at Vajpayee Bhawan, the state BJP headquarters in Guwahati, launched a book titled 'Emergency Diary'.

title: No Talk Of Change Of Chief Minister By High Command: Siddaramaiah's Son
content: Amid mounting speculation over a potential leadership change in Karnataka, Yathindra Siddaramaiah, son of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, has strongly dismissed the rumours, asserting that his father has the full backing of the party high command.

title: The favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the contenders
content: in the past 20 years, only 12 players have reached the gentlemen's final . Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic accounted for more than half of those 40 spots . despite a pretty clear hierarchy forming atop the women's tour, things are far different .

title: Mock drafts, rankings, order, analysis and more
content: the 2025 draft is set for July 13-14 in Atlanta, Georgia . the first round begins at 6 p.m. ET and will be broadcast live on ESPN and MLB Network . coverage of day 2 of the draft will be streamed on MLB.com beginning at 11:30 a.m .

title: In a 1st, spl champagne bottle tested in space
content: As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, its rolling out reels and reels of tales. If the first post office or a telephone connection paints one colour, the Stamp of a stock market scam or the ‘Jewel Thieves’ scandal paint yet another colour. If failure of a sounding rocket was a stepping stone, sending 104 satellites in one go was a podium. If farmer suicides are a bad climax, growing number of Unicorns are a grand entry. Chethan Kumar, Senior Assistant Editor, The Times of India, who alternates between the mundane goings-on of the hoi polloi and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and Jawans, feels: There’s always a story, one just has to find it. Read More

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Yankees announce George Costanza bobblehead giveaway for Aug. 21
content: the first 18,000 fans at the Yankees' matchup against the Boston Red Sox will receive a bobblehead of George Costanza sleeping under his desk . it coincides with "Seinfeld Night" at Yankee Stadium .

title: Fight results: Jake Paul dominates, defeats Julio Cesar Chavez Jr.
content: the judges scored the fight 99-91, 97-93 and 98-92 . Paul defeated former heavyweight king Mike Tyson by unanimous decision in November . he is now riding a six-fight winning streak since losing a split decision to Tommy Fury in February 2023 .

title: Chelsea win Club World Cup's most absurd game yet
content: a 4-1 win over Benfica set up a quarterfinal against Palmeiras next Friday . the blues will be extremely grateful they have six days to recover from this . a game that finished four hours and 38 minutes after it began .

title: Miami 'weaker' but ready to 'fight' to oust PSG
content: "Futbol Americas" head coach says his team needs to play near-perfect match against PSG . MLS side face off in the club world cup round of 16 on sunday . the 5-0 demolition of inter Milan in the final of the tournament is the first UEFA title .

title: NBA free agency: Cap space, best fits for all 30 teams

title: UFC 317 results: Topuria secures UFC lightweight title with KO of Oliveira
content: Ilia Topuria knocked out paddy Pimblett to claim the lightweight title in the first round of their UFC 317 main event on sunday . the former featherweight champion became the 10th person ever to win two UFC belts . he was the second-best pound-for-pound fighter in the world . his bitter rival, Paddy, entered the Octagon from the audience after topuria got his hand raised .

title: Parker, 2-time WS champ, 7-time All-Star, dies
